perturbation.original_text: This Promotion Agreement (the "Agreement") is dated as of January 26, 1998 between CNET, Inc. ("CNET") and Cyberian Outpost, Inc. (the "Company"). Pursuant to this Agreement, CNET will provide various links and other online and television promotions (collectively, the "Promotions") to the Company to assist the Company in promoting its products and services and facilitating the sale of products to potential buyers through its Internet site. CNET will be compensated by the Company for providing the Promotions. Accordingly, the parties hereby agree as follows:
perturbation.changed_text: This Promotion Agreement (the "Agreement") is dated as of January 26, 1998 between CNET, Inc. ("CNET") and Cyberian Outpost, Inc. (the "Corporation"). Pursuant to this Agreement, CNET will provide various links and other online and television promotions (collectively, the "Promotions") to the Corporation to assist the Corporation in promoting its products and services and facilitating the sale of products to potential buyers through its Internet site. CNET will be compensated by the Corporation for providing the Promotions. Accordingly, the parties hereby agree as follows:
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Company' is replaced with 'Corporation' without explicitly defining that 'Corporation' is the same entity as 'Company' which will cause confusion as the agreement progresses.

perturbation.original_text: 2.6  Reporting. Within 30 days after the end of each month during the Term,           CNET will provide a report to the Company indicating the number of           Retail Promotions displayed on the CNET Sites during such month and           the number of times that a User clicked on a Retail Promotion during           such month. CNET will also provide standard reporting for banner           advertisements and television Promotions.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.6  Reporting. Within 30 days after the end of each month during the Term,           CNET will provide a report to the Business indicating the number of           Retail Promotions displayed on the CNET Sites during such month and           the number of times that a User clicked on a Retail Promotion during           such month. CNET will also provide standard reporting for banner           advertisements and television Promotions.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Company' to 'Business' creates uncertainty about which entity CNET should report to. The term 'Business' isn't defined and may lead to a misunderstanding of the reporting structure.

perturbation.original_text: 3.1  Operation of Company Site. The Company will be responsible for           ensuring that each link embedded within an Online Promotion takes the           User to the appropriate area within the Company Site, and that the           Company Site functions with reasonable reliability and in a           commercially reasonable manner throughout the Term. In particular, the           Company agrees that the Company Site will comply with the performance           standards set forth in Exhibit B throughout the Term. Any failure by           the Company to comply with this paragraph will be deemed to be a           material breach of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.1  Operation of Corporate Site. The Enterprise will be responsible for           ensuring that each link embedded within an Online Promotion takes the           User to the appropriate area within the Corporate Site, and that the           Corporate Site functions with reasonable reliability and in a           commercially reasonable manner throughout the Term. In particular, the           Enterprise agrees that the Corporate Site will comply with the performance           standards set forth in Exhibit B throughout the Term. Any failure by           the Enterprise to comply with this paragraph will be deemed to be a           material breach of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'Company Site' with 'Corporate Site' and 'Company' with 'Enterprise' can lead to confusion regarding whose site and actions are governed by the agreement. There is no reference what Enterprise means in this context, giving space to arguments that it is not Cyberian Outpost.
